gnu.jpdf

Class PDFImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • gnu.jpdf.PDFObject
      • gnu.jpdf.PDFStream
        • gnu.jpdf.PDFImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.io.Serializable

    public class PDFImage
extends PDFStream
implements java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.io.Serializable

    This implements the Image XObject. Calling one of the drawImage methods of PDFGraphics will put all the necessary code into the pdf file, and the image will be encoded in ascii base 85, then deflated in zip format.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $, $Date: 2007/08/26 18:56:35 $
    Author:
    Eric Z. Beard (original version by Peter Mount), Matthew Hreljac, mhreljac@hotmail.com
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • base85Encoding

        private java.lang.String base85Encoding(java.lang.String stringToEncode)
                                 throws java.lang.NumberFormatException

        Adobe's base 85 does not follow the format used by ipv6 addresses. It simply starts with 33 and goes straight up without skipping any characters

        Parts of this method contributed by Mathew Hreljac

        Parameters:
        stringToEncode - a String value
        Returns:
        a String value
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
